project.teaser: The RDA TIGER aims to provide services to facilitate and support well-defined Working Groups between key European and international initiatives, resulting in concrete alignment, harmonisation, and standardisation of Open Science developments and technologies globally. In...
project.objective:
The RDA TIGER aims to provide services to facilitate and support well-defined Working Groups between key European and international initiatives, resulting in concrete alignment, harmonisation, and standardisation of Open Science developments and technologies globally. In particular the project will directly contribute to the European Open Science Cloud Partnership, by supporting (via the Working Groups) the international engagement and alignment of policies, technologies, methodologies, practices and other outputs of EOSC-related and other European Open Science developments; and develop and offer a service platform for these Working Groups, effectively identifying key partners for the groups, and increasing their work efficiency by facilitation and other support actions and ultimately maximising the impact WG results have on the EOSC, global Open Science, and society.
RDA TIGER leverages the demonstrably effective instrument of community-driven RDA Working Groups and the foundations of EOSC, RDA, CODATA, Research Software Alliance (ReSA), and the Open Science movement in general, and provides a way to efficiently use the RDA platform for internationalisation and standardisation of research outputs that allow science to be reproducible and scrutinised.
RDA TIGER service platform includes planning, engagement, communication, facilitation and finalisation services to the Working Groups, maximising the WG outputs, and their impact. Most of the RDA TIGER services have been tested in one form or another in earlier RDA-related projects both in Europe and internationally, demonstrating that they are realistic and achievable. RDA TIGER’s ambition stems from the concentrated use of these services, together with systematic quality control and improvement mechanisms, and via the careful selection of Working Groups which will maximize the impacts relevant to the Work Programme.
project.title: Research Data Alliance facilitation of Targeted International working Groups for EOSC-related Research solutions
project.keywords: Data Standards, policy harmonisation, Software standards, research evaluation, research outputs, open science

article.title: Working groups for European open science solutions

result.title: Definition and handbook of Facilitation Service
result.description: Specification of the facilitation support mechanisms with respective workflows and guidance for Facilitators as they support WGs from initiation to finalization phase.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - RDA TIGER (Research Data Alliance facilitation of Targeted International working Groups for EOSC-related Research solutions)
result.teaser: The RDA TIGER aims to provide services to facilitate and support well-defined Working Groups between key European and international initiatives, resulting in concrete alignment, harmonisation, and standardisation of Open Science developments and technologies globally. In...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: OS Landscape analysis and potential engagement targets
result.description: Details the first structured overview and results from the OS landscaping, to be aligned and used by WGs at the landscape awareness stage. Categorises on existing initiatives around open science topics, both European and global. An continuous report with second iteration in M18.

result.title: Guidelines for Support Management
result.description: These guidelines consist the main aspects of providing additional direct support for the RDA TIGER supported RDA working groups, such as procedures on providing and resourcing support actions, such as subcontracted services (consultancy), 3rd party support, or adoption grants.

result.title: Policy feedback to the EOSC Partnership
result.description: This report contains the policy feedback of key RDA TIGER outputs, results and experiences towards EOSC Partnership

result.title: Initial service quality Handbook
result.description: Practical handbook as an output of T6.2, setting out KPIs and feedback structures such as surveys and user engagement and service provider training mechanisms.

result.title: DMP Creation
result.description: This is the Data Management Plan for the project, containing management plan for the project-created datasets.

result.title: Report on Pilot Demonstrator WGs
result.description: Report on success and impact of the pilot WGs via structured feedback w WG co-chairs, take up of service, direct feedback on the different services leveraged including 3rd party support.

result.title: Engagement Services Status Update
result.description: Based on Identified target groups, a report on engagement approach and efficacy to bring on board and engage groups in WGs and future user communities

result.title: Rules of operation for the Selection Committee
result.description: Guidance document for composition of the Selection Committee, procedures and decision making for WGs should be chosen including selection criteria, meeting schedule, alignment with RDA’s principles.

result.title: Project Handbook
result.description: Describes all internal project processes, tracks deliverables and QC measures, templates for reporting and deliverables, internal communication procedures and responsibilities

result.title: Communication Toolkit
result.description: Delivers a suite of materials to support the outward facing communications of RDA TIGER, including project logo's and presentation templates. Stakeholders targeted and strategies for engaging new communities including communication procedures for all phases of the WG facilitation from landscaping to finalisation.

result.title: Description of Output Support Services and Maintenance Platform
result.description: This deliverable will set out the workflows to be developed in WP4 to support the ongoing maintenance of the WG outputs focusing on definition of outputs, policy guidance needed and technical requirements and optimisation for the maintenance platform. Particular efforts are aligned towards ensuring uptake of the project outputs outside of the normal RDA communities.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
